conversation.content: Good morning. I'm calling about some charges on my credit card statement that I don't recognize.
Good morning. I'd be happy to help you identify those charges. May I have your account number or the phone number associated with your account?
My account number is 4521-8847. The charges show as "TMG Holdings" but I haven't purchased anything from that company.
Thank you. I've located your account, customer ID CUS-88471-MK. Let me pull up your recent transaction history to review those charges with you.
I appreciate that. There are three charges from October that total about two hundred dollars.
I can see those transactions now. The charges dated October 12th for $67.99, October 18th for $84.50, and October 23rd for $47.51 are actually from our online marketplace.
But why would they appear under a completely different company name?

Excellent question. TMG Holdings is our parent company's payment processing entity, registered under merchant code MCC-5734. When you make purchases through our platform, the billing descriptor shows the processor's legal name.
That's confusing. Is there any way to make this clearer on future statements?

I understand your concern completely. While we cannot change how your bank displays the merchant name, I can enable email confirmations with reference number REF-2847-OCT that will match your statement charges exactly.
That would be helpful. Can you also confirm what those specific October purchases were for?

Certainly. The October 12th charge was for your software subscription renewal, order number ORD-67991-AB. October 18th was for digital storage upgrade, and October 23rd was for premium support services.
Now it makes sense. I did authorize those purchases but didn't connect them to TMG Holdings.
Of course.
Is this information documented anywhere in my account for future reference?
Yes, I'm adding a detailed note to your account right now under case number CASE-981147-TMG. You'll also receive an email within the next hour explaining the billing descriptor relationship.
Perfect. Will all future charges from your company appear this same way?

Yes, all charges will continue to appear as TMG Holdings on your statement. However, with the new email confirmations activated under setting ID SET-4471-EM, you'll receive immediate purchase details that reference both names.
Thank you for the thorough explanation. This resolves my concerns completely.
You're very welcome. I've also credited your account with a $10 courtesy credit under transaction TXN-88447-CR for the confusion. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

scenario: confused about charges appearing as a different company name
